function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Evidence that temperature modulates influenza virus survival independent of humidity","Impact":"Incomplete understanding of virus survival and transmission, leading to ineffective control measures","Mitigation":"Conduct further research to fully understand the relationship between temperature, humidity, and virus survival","Technologies":"Data analysis and modeling tools for studying virus survival in different environmental conditions","People":"Public health officials, epidemiologists, researchers","Owner":"Research institutions, public health organizations"},{"Description":"Influenza transmission between humans takes place indoors within a narrow range of temperatures, where AH and RH move in tandem","Impact":"Indoor environments may become hotspots for influenza transmission due to a narrow range of temperatures and humidity levels","Mitigation":"Implement effective ventilation and air filtration systems to regulate indoor temperature and humidity","Technologies":"HVAC systems, air purifiers, ventilation monitoring tools","People":"Building managers, HVAC technicians, public health officials","Owner":"Building management companies, public health organizations"},{"Description":"Relationship between RH and transmission via droplets and aerosols, where RH affects their physics and chemistry","Impact":"Limited understanding of the role of humidity in droplet and aerosol transmission of influenza, leading to suboptimal control measures","Mitigation":"Conduct research to understand the impact of humidity on droplet and aerosol transmission of influenza","Technologies":"Advanced microscopy, environmental monitoring tools, simulation software for aerosol behavior","People":"Microbiologists, environmental engineers, public health officials","Owner":"Research institutions, public health organizations"}]}
